oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Four years of experience with the control of plum rust in organic production
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Häseli, Andreas
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
Fruit and berries
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Plum rust Tranzschelia pruni spinosa is an important disease and at present, no fungicide is registered for the organic agriculture in Switzerland. The efficacy of different fungicides potentially suitable for organic production and the susceptibility of different plum varieties against plum rust was tested during four years in different field trials in Switzerland. With the seven tested varieties only Top and Elena showed a clearly higher tolerance. With four to five treatments in the main infection period mid of June to mid of July the following results were obtained: Pandorra (Fennel oil) and Trilogy (Azadirachtin-free Neemoil) did not obtain a sufficient effect. Very high significant effects of about 80 % could be obtained with lime sulphur, Thiovit (wettable sulphur) and somewhat less with Serenade (Bacillus subtilis).
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Häseli, Andreas (2004) Four years of experience with the control of plum rust in organic production. [Vierjährige Versuchserfahrungen zur Regulierung des Zwetschgenrostes.] In: Boos, Markus (Ed.) Ecofruit - 11th International Conference on Cultivation Technique and Phytopathological Problems in Organic Fruit-Growing: Proceedings to the Conference from 3rd February to 5th February 2004 at Weinsberg/Germany, pp. 115-121.
